verses.text_plain: So Abijah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David: and Asa his son reigned in his stead. In his days the land was quiet ten years.
verses.verse_html: 1So Abijah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David: and Asa his son reigned in his stead. In his days the land was quiet ten years.

tokens.text: in his stead. In his days

verses.text_plain: And Asa did that which was good and right in the eyes of the Lord his God:
verses.verse_html: 2And Asa did that which was good and right in the eyes of the Lord his God:

verses.text_plain: For he took away the altars of the strange gods, and the high places, and brake down the images, and cut down the groves:
verses.verse_html:
3For he took away the altars of the strange gods, and the high places, and brake down the images, and cut down the groves: ▼
▼ images: Heb. statues

verses.text_plain: And commanded Judah to seek the Lord God of their fathers, and to do the law and the commandment.
verses.verse_html: 4And commanded Judah to seek the Lord God of their fathers, and to do the law and the commandment.

verses.text_plain: Also he took away out of all the cities of Judah the high places and the images: and the kingdom was quiet before him.
verses.verse_html:
5Also he took away out of all the cities of Judah the high places and the images: and the kingdom was quiet before him. ▼
▼ images: Heb. sun images

footnotes.body_html: ▼ images: Heb. sun images

verses.text_plain: And he built fenced cities in Judah: for the land had rest, and he had no war in those years; because the Lord had given him rest.
verses.verse_html: 6And he built fenced cities in Judah: for the land had rest, and he had no war in those years; because the Lord had given him rest.

verses.text_plain: Therefore he said unto Judah, Let us build these cities, and make about them walls, and towers, gates, and bars, while the land is yet before us; because we have sought the Lord our God, we have sought him, and he hath given us rest on every side. So they built and prospered.
verses.verse_html: 7Therefore he said unto Judah, Let us build these cities, and make about them walls, and towers, gates, and bars, while the land is yet before us; because we have sought the Lord our God, we have sought him, and he hath given us rest on every side. So they built and prospered.

tokens.text: and he hath given us rest

verses.text_plain: And Asa had an army of men that bare targets and spears, out of Judah three hundred thousand; and out of Benjamin, that bare shields and drew bows, two hundred and fourscore thousand: all these were mighty men of valour.
verses.verse_html: 8And Asa had an army of men that bare targets and spears, out of Judah three hundred thousand; and out of Benjamin, that bare shields and drew bows, two hundred and fourscore thousand: all these were mighty men of valour.

verses.text_plain: And there came out against them Zerah the Ethiopian with an host of a thousand thousand, and three hundred chariots; and came unto Mareshah.
verses.verse_html: 9And there came out against them Zerah the Ethiopian with an host of a thousand thousand, and three hundred chariots; and came unto Mareshah.

verses.text_plain: Then Asa went out against him, and they set the battle in array in the valley of Zephathah at Mareshah.
verses.verse_html: 10Then Asa went out against him, and they set the battle in array in the valley of Zephathah at Mareshah.

tokens.text: him, and they set the battle

verses.text_plain: And Asa cried unto the Lord his God, and said, Lord, it is nothing with thee to help, whether with many, or with them that have no power: help us, O Lord our God; for we rest on thee, and in thy name we go against this multitude. O Lord, thou art our God; let not man prevail against thee.
verses.verse_html:
11And Asa cried unto the Lord his God, and said, Lord, it is nothing with thee to help, whether with many, or with them that have no power: help us, O Lord our God; for we rest on thee, and in thy name we go against this multitude. O Lord, thou art our God; let not man prevail against thee. ▼
▼ man: or, mortal man

tokens.text: or with them that have no power
on thee, and in thy name

footnotes.body_html: ▼ man: or, mortal man

verses.text_plain: So the Lord smote the Ethiopians before Asa, and before Judah; and the Ethiopians fled.
verses.verse_html: 12So the Lord smote the Ethiopians before Asa, and before Judah; and the Ethiopians fled.

verses.text_plain: And Asa and the people that were with him pursued them unto Gerar: and the Ethiopians were overthrown, that they could not recover themselves; for they were destroyed before the Lord, and before his host; and they carried away very much spoil.
verses.verse_html:
13And Asa and the people that were with him pursued them unto Gerar: and the Ethiopians were overthrown, that they could not recover themselves; for they were destroyed before the Lord, and before his host; and they carried away very much spoil. ▼
▼ destroyed: Heb. broken

verses.text_plain: And they smote all the cities round about Gerar; for the fear of the Lord came upon them: and they spoiled all the cities; for there was exceeding much spoil in them.
verses.verse_html: 14And they smote all the cities round about Gerar; for the fear of the Lord came upon them: and they spoiled all the cities; for there was exceeding much spoil in them.

tokens.text: came upon them: and they spoiled

verses.text_plain: They smote also the tents of cattle, and carried away sheep and camels in abundance, and returned to Jerusalem.
verses.verse_html: 15They smote also the tents of cattle, and carried away sheep and camels in abundance, and returned to Jerusalem.
